question: Which country has recently exited from the ‘Open Skies Treaty’?
explanation:
The Government of Russia has recently announced its decision on pulling out of the Open Skies treaty.
The treaty came into effect in 2002, which permits a member country to spy on any part of the host nation, with the latter’s consent. As per the treaty, any signatory country can make aerial imaging over the host nation after giving a notice of 72 hours and sharing the exact flight path.
